title: ActiveSupport::MessagePack::UnserializableObjectError: Unsupported type ActiveSupport::SafeBuffer
body:
### Steps to reproduce

```ruby
# frozen_string_literal: true

require "bundler/inline"

gemfile(true) do
  source "https://rubygems.org"

  # If you want to test against edge Rails replace the previous line with this:
  gem "rails", github: "rails/rails", branch: "main"

  gem "msgpack"
end

require "active_support"
require "active_support/core_ext/object/blank"
require "minitest/autorun"

require "active_support/message_pack"

class BugTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase
  def test_msgpack
    serializer = ActiveSupport::Messages::SerializerWithFallback[:message_pack]
    assert_equal serializer.load(serializer.dump(ActiveSupport::SafeBuffer.new)), ''
  end

  def test_json
    serializer = ActiveSupport::Messages::SerializerWithFallback[:json]
    assert_equal serializer.load(serializer.dump(ActiveSupport::SafeBuffer.new)), ''
  end
end
```

### Expected behavior

The message pack serializer might encode similar to the default JSON serializer that did encode the `ActiveSupport::SafeBuffer` into a string.

### Actual behavior

We were testing using `:message_pack` as a cookie serializer, but some code set a flash message with a localized string that was refused by the message pack serializer when encoding the cookie.

The following error was raised:

```
ActiveSupport::MessagePack::UnserializableObjectError:
  Unsupported type ActiveSupport::SafeBuffer for object "<message>"
```


### System configuration
**Rails version**: 7.2.2.1, rails/rails edge
**Ruby version**: 3.3.5
